newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Govt, NZ First get high disapproval rating - TV3 poll.
newsitem.headline: Govt, NZ First get high disapproval rating - TV3 poll.

text.p: Three quarters of respondents disapproved of the job New Zealand First was doing and 59 percent said the coalition government was performing worse than the former National government, according to a TV3 poll published on Thursday.

Some 38 percent of respondents said NZ First leader Winston Peters was doing a quite a bad job or a very bad job as Treasurer and his disapproval rating in his role as deputy prime minister was 66 percent.
The poll sample, conducted by CM Research, was of 300 people and was taken 100 days after the centre-right coalition government was formed by the National and New Zealand First Parties.
The main opposition Labour Party received a 60 percent approval rating of the job it was doing.
